original_title: Sri Lanka to draw up law for casino regulator
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s cabinet of ministers had cleared the drawing up of a law to set up a gaming regulatory authority, a statement said.
The casino regulator will ensure that the taxes are collected, counter criminal and minimize negative effects to society and individuals from gaming.
The proposal made by President Ranil Wickremesinghe as the minister of finance to instruct the legal draftsman to draw up a bill to set up a gaming regulatory authority was approved.
Reports have suggested that there should be an entrance fee to discourage entry to casinos.
Sri Lanka now has at least two casinos which have operated for decades.
Sri Lanka;s John Keells Holdings is also planning a casino in its Cinnamon Life integrated resort. (Colombo/June27/2023)
